meanings.definition: To load (a gun) with fresh ammunition.
meanings.sent1: He reloads his gun before going hunting.
meanings.sent2: The soldier quickly reloads his rifle during the battle.
meanings.sent3: After the paintball game, he reloads his gun with colorful pellets.
meanings.sent4: She reloads her camera with a new roll of film, ready to capture more memories.
meanings.sent5: The chef reloads the pastry bag with fresh cream to decorate the cake.

meanings.definition: To refresh or renew (a webpage or application).
meanings.sent1: She reloads the webpage to see the updated news.
meanings.sent2: When the video freezes, he reloads the streaming page.
meanings.sent3: He reloads the game app to beat his high score.
meanings.sent4: The student reloads the online quiz to correct the answers.
meanings.sent5: To watch the live stream, she reloads the event page multiple times.

meanings.definition: To replenish or resupply with something.
meanings.sent1: The hiker reloads his backpack with water before the long trek.
meanings.sent2: She quickly reloads the bird feeder with seeds for the hungry birds.
meanings.sent3: He reloads the vending machine with snacks for the office break.
meanings.sent4: The store manager reloads the shelves with fresh produce every morning.
meanings.sent5: To keep the fire burning, he reloads the woodpile with logs.
